text: Nora Orlandi (28 June 1933 â€“ 1 January 2025), also known as Joan Christian, was an Italian pianist, violinist, soprano vocalist, composer, and actress. She composed scores for Spaghetti Westerns. She wrote a short piece for Sergio Martino's The Strange Vice of Mrs Wardh (1971) which was later reused in Quentin Tarantino's Kill Bill: Volume 2 (2004). Orlandi died in Rome, Italy on 1 January 2025, at the age of 91. == Select filmography == * Johnny Yuma (1966) * Clint the Stranger (1967) * Ten Thousand Dollars for a Massacre (1967) * Death at Owell Rock (1967) * The Sweet Body of Deborah (1968) * $100,000 for a Killing (1968) * Double Face (1969) * The Strange Vice of Mrs Wardh (1971) ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1933 births Category:2025 deaths Category:Italian pianists Category:Italian violinists Category:Italian composers Category:Italian movie actors Category:People from Lombardy
title: Nora Orlandi
